SEARCH
Package com.example.taskmanager

Class PriorityService

java.lang.Object
com.example.taskmanager.PriorityService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PriorityService extends Object implements Serializable
Provides services for managing priorities.

Allows adding, updating, deleting, and retrieving priorities. It ensures that a default priority always exists.

See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PriorityService()
    Constructs a new PriorityService instance and loads priorities from the JSON storage.

  • Constructor Details

    • PriorityService

      public PriorityService()
      Constructs a new PriorityService instance and loads priorities from the JSON storage. Ensures the default priority exists and initializes the next available ID.

  • Method Details

    • addPriority

      public void addPriority(String name)
      Adds a new priority with the specified name, if it does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new priority
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a priority with the same name already exists

    • updatePriority

      public void updatePriority(int id, String newName)
      Updates the name of an existing priority identified by its ID. Also updates related tasks to reflect the new priority name.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the priority to update
      newName - the new name for the priority
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the priority is the default priority or does not exist

    • deletePriority

      public void deletePriority(int id)
      Deletes a priority identified by its ID. Also replace all tasks associated with the deleted priority with default priority.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the priority to delete
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the priority is the default priority or does not exist

    • getPriorities

      public List<com.example.taskmanager.Priority> getPriorities()
      Getts a list of all priorities.
      Returns:
      a list of all priorities

    • getPriorityById

      public com.example.taskmanager.Priority getPriorityById(int id)
      Gets a priority by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the priority to retrieve
      Returns:
      the priority with the specified ID
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no priority with the specified ID exists

    • getPriorityByName

      public com.example.taskmanager.Priority getPriorityByName(String name)
      Gets a priority by its name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the priority to retrieve
      Returns:
      the priority with the specified name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no priority with the specified name exists
